title: (x) Sun Microsystems modern sans - Sun {Yves}
content:
I can't ID this one myself. I've asked a few people and tried whatthefont from multiple sources as well. I originally guessed Meta, or Fedra sans.

I think it's probably easiest to just present a few URLs, they use it for every header:

[http://www.sun.com/software/solaris/get.jsp](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019160004/http:/www.sun.com/software/solaris/get.jsp "http://www.sun.com/software/solaris/get.jsp") "It's that easy"  
 [http://www.sun.com/products/index.jsp](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019160004/http:/www.sun.com/products/index.jsp "http://www.sun.com/products/index.jsp") "Get smart. Save green."  
 [http://www.sun.com/servers/index.jsp](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019160004/http:/www.sun.com/servers/index.jsp "http://www.sun.com/servers/index.jsp") "Triple your capacity"

Thanks guys!
author: Trevor Curtis

comments.content: It's [Luc(as) de Groots](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019160004/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Luc%28as%29%20de%20Groots)'s [Sun](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019160004/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=sun) and it's come up a couple of times before on Typophile. If you know what you're looking for maybe do a Search next time. ;^)

I had actually searched for "Sun Microsystems" before here.... probably should've tried harder, but I know you guys are good:)

Thanks
Slow? Pff!! You beat me only by a minute.
[Second hit.](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019160004/http:/www.google.com/search?q=site:typophile.com%20sun%20microsystems) Use Google and narrow your search to Typophile. :^)

[Only one (irrelevant) hit](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019160004/http:/typophile.com/search/node/sun%20microsystems).  
I’d suggest removing the typophile search if it is no use at all. This way (sending people there and then giving them further advice) seems to be a waste of time for both sides, no?

Florian said: <cite>"I’d suggest removing the typophile search if it is no use at all. This way (sending people there and then giving them further advice) seems to be a waste of time for both sides, no?"</cite>

Maybe not remove but replace it and integrate Google Search instead?

I have to third the replacement of the typophile search system. I wonder, does it cost anything to use the Google search in a website?

Mike Diaz

I get two different threads, second and third link, using Grant's search.

[http://www.google.com/search?q=site:typophile.com%20sun%20microsystems](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019160004/http:/www.google.com/search?q=site:typophile.com%20sun%20microsystems "http://www.google.com/search?q=site:typophile.com%20sun%20microsystems")
Yup, that's what I linked to a couple of replies higher. O:^) :^P
And the third link is just the RSS for the second one, so that doesn't count. :^P
Aw, I'm really being obnoxious. I'll have some making up to do in Brighton. ;^)
